definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
palsy/trembling paralysis/used for Parkinson's disease 帕金森病[Pa4 jin1 sen1 bing4]

sentences.english: The grid shimmers with " current" or grid flux.
sentences.chinese: 网格以“涌流”或网格流动变化轻轻震颤着。

sentences.english: Increases in intragastric pressure with succinylcholine administration, when they do occur, appear to correlate…
sentences.chinese: 如果胃内压出现的话，其程度和肌束震颤的强度相关。

sentences.english: Increases in intragastric pressure with succinylcholine administration, when they do occur, appear to correlate with the magnitude and the intensity of fasciculations.
sentences.chinese: 如果胃内压出现的话，其程度和肌束震颤的强度相关。

sentences.english: The jasmine wreath that you wove me thrills to my heart like praise.
sentences.chinese: 你给我编的茉莉花环使我心震颤，像是受了赞扬。

sentences.english: The chattering of teeth from the cold or from rage.
sentences.chinese: 牙齿因为寒冷或暴怒而震颤。

sentences.english: Intense artillery strikes and waves of aerial bombardment were reported across the Gaza Strip.
sentences.chinese: 深入的炮击，和飞机轰炸的震颤，贯穿整个加沙地带。

sentences.english: Hester looked at him with the thrill of another joy.
sentences.chinese: 海丝特望着他，心头又是一阵喜悦的震颤。

sentences.english: Krakatau normally produces five tremors per hour .
sentences.chinese: 喀拉喀托通常会产生五个震颤每小时。

sentences.english: Even the sound of a fart will shake the floor of the third floor.
sentences.chinese: 放个屁声音大点儿三楼的楼板都震颤。

sentences.english: At dawn, two tremors shook Melbourne.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时分，墨尔本遭受再次震颤。

sentences.english: The site is aflutter can be easily hear vascular murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 有震颤的部位可很容易听到血管杂音。

sentences.english: The effects of Nystagmus can also be reduced by drugs.
sentences.chinese: 眼球震颤也可以通过药物来改善症状。

sentences.english: The jasmine wreath that you wove me thrills to my heart like praise.
sentences.chinese: 你编织的茉莉花环像一种荣耀，震颤了我的心。

sentences.english: When I woke at dawn my heart was thrilling tremulously as I stepped outside.
sentences.chinese: 清晨醒来，起身走到外面，我的心里震颤不已。

sentences.english: The whole house trembled when the train went by.
sentences.chinese: 火车经过时，整座房子都在震颤。

definition: variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
